alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 2:08PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Floyd, western Polk and southern Chattooga Counties through 300 PM EST... At 208 PM EST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a line of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Broomtown to Coloma to near Sulphur Springs, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and increased chance of a brief tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...While winds should result in minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects, the leading edge of this line of storms has also exhibited areas of localized rotation. A brief tornado could quickly form. Locations impacted include... Rome, Cedartown, Cave Spring, Shannon, Lyerly, Pinson, Lindale, Esom Hill, Tidings, Armuchee, Seney, Coosa, Chattoogaville, James H. Floyd State Park, Holland and Etna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately.
